@nofish: As far as I know, it is currently impossible for a zite developer to communicate with the zeronet api, if js cannot be used(if the zite is used with the /raw/ prefix). Can you add the ability, to do cmd calls, in a php query kind of way? This would allow for zites, that don't rely on js, to still work, by using html forms to communicate with the api(zeronet client). How this could look: Have an api page at (for example) 127.0.0.1:43110/api, that just forwards the received cmd to the zeronet client and in an zite.html have something like: ```


``` For the 'Safe' button, this will result in: `127.0.0.1:43110/api?cmd=fileWrite&inner_path=data.json&content=ThisIsSomeTextOneCouldPostSomewhereWithoutJSEnabled` and for the 'publish' button: `127.0.0.1:43110/api?cmd=sitePublish&inner_path=data.json` With zites that work without js, the user no longer needs to blindly trust the zite developer, to not include some malicious js(mining crypto/some js exploit/leak the ip to websites outside Zeronet/...). The reason I post this here is, that I don't have a ~~microsoft~~ github account to open an issue there, I would be grateful if someone could open one for me.

Really looking forward to the python 3 update!
